intro: Bothriocline eupatorioides, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small blue or purple clouds. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces showy, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Bothriocline eupatorioides is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to support local pollinators.
